I would give this response a grade of 85.

This response effectively clarifies the source of holiness in becoming a saint, emphasizing that it is not due to one's own deeds, but rather because of faith in Jesus Christ and His saving work. The writer also accurately highlights the importance of love, forgiveness, and obedience as key aspects of this spiritual journey.

The response does a good job of explaining the biblical teaching on holiness, citing the call to be holy and pleasing to God (1 Corinthians 6:19-20), and emphasizing the role of the Holy Spirit in guiding believers. The writer also correctly notes that becoming a saint is not just about following rules or rituals, but rather a deepening of one's relationship with Jesus Christ.

The only area for improvement would be to provide more direct connection between this response and the concern about clarifying the source of holiness. While the response does touch on the idea that believers become saints through faith in Jesus Christ, it could be more explicitly linked to the concern.
